intro: Falcaria longiloba, commonly known as the long-stemmed cowplant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Falcaria longiloba contains various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in ethnobotanical and medicinal research.
